item.description:
Hi Everyone,
I wanted to get in one afternoon/evening kayak event in before the weekend, (not having one this weekend)
i am going to the White Water Rafting trip Saturday and then Tom Lobo's Party Sunday.

So this is the best evening of the week so far for some event like this.

For GPS / other, this # of 125 is an approximate address number but close enough, Somers / Somersville CT ? or follow my directions.
I see the map link above shows it correctly.


The pond is about a half mile long and the river is about another 2 miles long.

We explore some of the pond areas then go up stream..
Then do a simple Barbie-q before heading home..

bring bug spray, bug juice, some food (i have some chicken brest to cook) and maybe a simple long sleeve top if its cool out..

Directions: From I-91, take exit 47 E (Enfield mall area), go east on rte 190 for 5.3 miles. and turn right (south) onto SCHOOL STREET, (route 186 (left) goes north here). This part of town is Somersville.

The driveway access is on the left in 0.3 miles right before the bridge/dam, park anywhere near the water or tree, picnick bench, area if its not used yet.



I will be driving a blue Toyota Avalon towing my kayak trailer with the orange traffic cones.



In the event of rain, the event gets canceled..

This is most likely the northern most area for paddling i will list, the rest will be more southern and a few more Farmington river trips near Strawberry Park..

Tuesday: A chance of showers and thunderstorms before 11am, then a slight chance of showers. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 80. West wind between 6 and 11 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

Tuesday Night: Mostly clear, with a low around 55. West wind between 3 and 7 mph.
Ok i really dont know what it will be like tomorrow at this time..but check the weather..

It looks ok so far, but ya never know?LOL

$ 10.00 doughnation per kayak rented.
